meanings.definition: Lack of preservation or protection of something.
meanings.sent1: The nonconservations of the historical artifacts led to their deterioration.
meanings.sent2: The nonconservations of the forest resulted in the loss of many endangered species.
meanings.sent3: The nonconservations of the ice cream in the sun turned it into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her nonconservations of time were like letting sand slip through her fingers.
meanings.sent5: The nonconservations of the fragile vase caused it to shatter into pieces.

meanings.definition: Failure to maintain or sustain something.
meanings.sent1: The nonconservations of the old building led to its collapse.
meanings.sent2: His nonconservations of his health resulted in frequent illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The nonconservations of the plan made it fall apart like a house of cards.
meanings.sent4: Their nonconservations of the relationship caused it to crumble like a cookie.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring the nonconservations of the car's engine led to a breakdown on the highway.

meanings.definition: Absence of conservation or preservation efforts.
meanings.sent1: The nonconservations of the environment are evident in the increasing pollution levels.
meanings.sent2: The nonconservations of the historical site allowed it to fall into disrepair.
meanings.sent3: Their nonconservations of the garden turned it into a wild jungle.
meanings.sent4: The nonconservations of the documents left them vulnerable to damage.
meanings.sent5: The nonconservations of the forest led to the loss of its natural beauty.
